title: Where do I find anyone who can pay decently for my writing skills? - Quora

response.answer_text: When I started freelancing in 1970, I used Writer’s Market. It’s still a good source. I picked business periodicals since they were hungrier than consumer pubs  for stories, and you could churn out a story a day. 10 cents a word,  1000 words=$100. If you’re interested in those markets, pick an industry you know, read their trade journals, and query them. Here’s a tip: What questions can you pluck from the trades articles(e.g., specialty, gross sales, location types, etc.) and write them in a little book. Then, every interview ask all those questions. Pretty soon you can expand your questions to fit many industries and markets. Today, of course, the internet has the most info, so hone your research skills by searching. Most of all, write.

I prefer freelancer or fever or upwork where you can post your gigs and people will contact you for the work. But as far I know for you to be popular on these sites you have some skills that you need to show on your profile. So try writing some guest posts so that people will know you are good at writing.
